alert.note: Alert for City of Chesapeake; City of Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 19 at 4:30PM EDT until July 19 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... The eastern City of Chesapeake in southeastern Virginia... The City of Virginia Beach in southeastern Virginia... * Until 515 PM EDT. * At 429 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Kempsville to near Northwest, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Princess Anne around 435 PM EDT. Virginia Beach and Back Bay around 445 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Rudee Heights, Mount Pleasant, Princess Anne Plaza, Sigma, Sandbridge Beach, Oceana NAS, Munden, Macons Corner, Pungo and Greenbrier. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for northeastern North Carolina...and southeastern Virginia.

area.areaDesc: City of Chesapeake; City of Virginia Beach
